sub_title: Global CRO at Siemens Financial Services - Commercial Finance
summary:
Experienced manager with a proven track record in vendor finance and the execution of international assignments and management of teams. Implementing global sales, operations and risk strategies and leading these successfully at global and local level in a disciplined manner. I am passionate for developing people and creating professional teams that outperform objectives and deliver sustainable results. 

All senior management positions involved important turn-around scenarios that required significant change management skills. Setting high quality expectations for myself and others, strong analytical skills and embracing professional challenges in an international setting have been a key success factor throughout my career.

Over the last 20+ years, I have progressed my career successfully for a fast growing global financial services organization. I have worked in different Senior Management roles in 8 countries (for 12 years), among others in China, Italy and Scandinavia. As Global CRO for Siemens Financial Services COF, I will be working out of Munich Germany and be a member of the Management Board for SFS Commercial Finance and a member of the Global SFS Leadership Team. 
 
From a regulatory perspective, I was Statutory Director for our Italian and China (bank) legal entities and part of the Board of Directors in the USA for the joint-venture between DLL and a Dutch Global Healthcare Manufacturer. 

My all-round career is furthermore enhanced by a post-academic degree in Finance and Control and Executive Education at the Wharton School of Business.

Prior to working for Siemens and DLL, I was a teacher at the Finance Faculty of the University of Maastricht, in the Netherlands.

education.field_of_study: How to lead and manage people

school.name: Maastricht University School of Business and Economics

profile_positions.description:
Leading a global team of approx. 500 employees across 14 countries, multiple jurisdictions and banking regulations and collaborating with all Siemens divisions. 

Global responsibility for the development, implementation and monitoring of all risk management strategies of the SFS Commercial Finance (COF)business. Areas of attention include Regional Risk, Global Asset Management, Portfolio Management & Workout, Invoice Financing and Risk Processes & Tools. The CRO position is a permanent member of SFS COF Management Board and the SFS Global Leadership Team.
profile_positions.title: Global CRO at SFS COF, Member Board of Directors of regulated entities in France, Sweden and China

profile_positions.description:
Member of the Management Team for the Global Business Unit (GBU) Healthcare and CleanTech. Responsible for the development and expansion of global vendor relationships. Heading the Global New Business Development team with members looking at new business opportunities in the Americas, Europe and AsiaPac. Special interest in growing the business in emerging countries. 

Since August 2017, also representing the GBU in the Asia Pacific Region.
profile_positions.title: VP Global New Business Development Healthcare & Cleantech

profile_positions.description:
Member of the Global Business Unit Healthcare and CleanTech. Managing the global vendor relationship for one of the leading global healthcare manufacturers in the world. Special interest in growing the business in emerging countries. Since August 2017, appointed as GBU representative in Asia Pacific Region aiming to grow  the healthcare and cleantech business. Special attention to growth markets China and India.

Furthermore, and in line with previous position, continue to execute on the company's strategy to develop a dedicated Retail Finance channel for medical equipment in Europe. Optimizing the commercial, risk and operational aspects so that sustainable results are achieved.
profile_positions.title: Global Account Manager Healthcare and CleanTech and GBU Representative in the Asia Pacific Region

profile_positions.description: Member of the Global Business Unit Healthcare. A leading management position focusing on the development of our healthcare channel business in Europe. Optimizing the commercial, risk and operational aspects so that long-term sustainable results are achieved. Additionally, acting as European Account Executive for strategic vendor programs.
profile_positions.title: International Program Manager Healthcare Europe

profile_positions.description:
Member of Management Team. 
Leading the Healthcare Business Unit (BU) from a sales perspective. The BU accounts for 70% of the China balance sheet and is -from a volume perspective- among the top-3 countries in the world. The commercial team consists of 27 sales members across China, including regional sales managers, account managers, program managers and a team dedicated to new business development. The Healthcare Business Unit accounted for € 180m new business volume per year and covered the management of multiple international and local vendor accounts

Periodical interaction and support provided to other countries in the APAC region.
profile_positions.title: Healthcare Business Unit Director China

profile_positions.description:
Member of the Management Team. 
Head of department that covers Credit Management, Collection & Recovery and the Internal Audit function, i.e. process control (20 FTE). Successful management of risk cost budget in a challenging environment and economy, while still enabling to grow the company commercially.

profile_positions.description:
Member of Management Team.

Contribute to the delivery of better service to our vendor partners and clients. Increased automation levels and build-in of relevant checks in the contract management process (start-to-end). Coordination of local Operational Excellence initiatives.
profile_positions.title: COO China

profile_positions.description:
Chairman of Country's Management Team and Credit Committee.

Leading the vendor finance activities in Office Technology, Healthcare, Agriculture, Transportation and Construction. Accomplished a consistent increase of the portfolio and turned a loss-making entity in to a profitable, best-in-class unit through organic growth and portfolio acquisition.
profile_positions.title: Country Manager Italy

Member of the Country's Management Team.

Responsible for the implementation of highly automated eCom platform that improved the company's operational capabilities, speed of service, data accuracy and the commercial strength of our organization in the vendor finance retail (dealer) market.

Coordination of various risk initiatives and global projects in the field of risk management between Europe and America division.
